name: Chicken Stuffing
ingredients: 3 or 4 slices of bread – wet with water squeeze excess water.
1 large bag Pepperidge farm stuffing crumbs
1 roll of breakfast sausage (Jones, Jimmy Dean)
1 box uncle ben’s long grain & wild rice
2 – bunches broccoli - chop up tops only
½ pound of cooked bacon – crumble
2 packages of kraft cheese (3 kinds shredded or cheddar)
1 Tomato cut into bite size pieces
instructions: put stuffing into chicken – bake chicken according to Betty Crocker
Sauté onion in veg. oil, add to bowl with stuffing.  Brown & crumble sausage, drain.
Add rice & sausage to stuffing.  Add poultry seasoning (small amt.).  Mix well.
Bake in greased casserole at 350 for 30-40 minutes.
Pour off grease, put juices in pan, brown chunks too.
Heat low then add flour and water (potato) then boil stirring continually with fork, add pepper – add more water (potato).
You can make in advance and refrigerate.
In a large bowl, toss together lettuce, cucumber and red onion; set aside
In a glass jar with a tight-fitted lid, combine all dressing ingredients; shake until well blended
Just before serving, pour about ½ cup of dressing over salad; toss lightly
If cooking for two: dressing may be kept in the refrigerator for up to 1 week

If cooking for two: dressing may be kept in the refrigerator for up to 1 week
Potato salad – red potatoes medium size – boils in water and adds salt 30 minutes - check with fork.
Step 1:Peel potatoes after they boil, add dressing from below.
